inn1.comm: pitched up and punched down the ground, weight over the ball and that's a nicely timed boundary
back of a length, on the stumps and turned towards square leg
short ball again, this seats up inviting off the pitch and Sibanda hoicks a flat pull shot in front of deep square leg, there's a man out there but he won't get round
length and let's this one through
slower ball, defended back down the track from in front of the stumps
good length, angling in and defended back to the bowler
short and wide, room to swing the arms and he crashes a cut shot through point for another four
length ball in the corridor, better line and Chibhabha leaves this one alone
gets on the front foot to defend
touch short, reasonably close to the stumps and neatly punched off the back foot square but Pollard dives well to make the stop
fires a good length ball through outside off stump, the batsman shoulders arms
length ball a foot or so outside off stump, good pace and carry, lets it go
tighter, on a length around off, pushed out towards point
pitched up and drifting in towards middle and leg, driven back to mid-on, not a clean connection
slides down the leg side, hint of swing but it turns the ball into a wide
good indrift again from Best, and a better line, as Sibanda is forced to bring his bat down let to keep out the yorker
length ball, pitching around off and coming in, turned off the pads
back of a length, outside off stump, played off the back foot towards mid-off
in the channel, gets forward and elects to leave
angled in and holding its line off a good length outside off, raises his bat out of the way again
straighter line, slightly short of a length and neatly worked off the body through square leg
length ball, blocked into the off side from in front of off stump
line and length in the channel, consistent stuff from Roach but it's still wide enough for the batsman to leave comfortably
shorter and rising up towards the ribs, blocked on the back foot and Roach fields in his follow-through
turns a length ball off the pads for a single through midwicket
wide of the stumps, lets the ball sail through
pitched up and homing in on the base of off, not quite yorker length though and it's punched towards cover
stays back and defends a shortish ball outside off
plenty of zip from broad-shouldered Tino, this is over middle stump and blocked from the crease
little bit wide, maybe takes the pace off and the ball stays low as Sibanda fiddles a late cut but fails to connect
length, outside the line of off, pushed into a gap in the covers but the fielders quickly swoop
length ball, angled in towards the wicket, Chibhabha tries to drive on the up and the bat turns in his hand, deflecting the ball on to his front pad and away on the off side
opens the face and drives behind point but Pollard again throws his skyscraper frame earthward and drags the ball in - terrific bit of fielding
length delivery, drifting in, the batsman steps out and watches it through
straighter line and nudged towards mid-on from in front of the stumps
full and pitching around off, gets forward and punches a drive to mid-off - plenty of activity from Chibhabha in that over but it goes down as a maiden
defended on the back foot in front of the stumps
Sibanda advances, attempting to assert himself against the new bowler, hits cross-batted back down the track but Russell gets a hand on it and it rolls to mid-off
length ball outside the line of off, played towards point
shorter and at the body, goes back in the crease and pats it towards square leg
gets across and taps a length ball square on the off side
ah ha, there's the tonic, a short and wide delivery from Russell and Sibanda carves it over point for the first boundary since the third over
goodish length ball around the line of off, driven on the up but well stopped by cover scrambling to his right
gets forward and pushes a length ball into the covers again
full and veering from off to middle and leg, clipped off the pads through midwicket
goes back and across and plays with a straight bat to short extra-cover
back of a length again and that's well timed from the crease, driving through the covers, they run well too to pick up three
nearly gives it away from the final ball with a windy woof to a wide, length ball, didn't get anywhere near it really but the drive missed everything
floated up outside off stump, leans over the ball and picks a gap in the covers, Chibhabha loping back to the bowler's end in time for a second
tossed up and defended into the off side
on the stumps and played back down the track
the wrong 'un, spinning away from Sibanda as he tries to drive off the back foot, the ball thudding into the keeper's gloves
quicker ball, gets across and pushes towards point
drags the length down a touch and defended on the back foot
length ball, cut away through point
back of a length and rising sharply, well played from back in the crease, keeps it down and gets a single out towards deep backward point
no stroke to a good length ball in the channel
length ball outside off, crouches and thinks about cutting but it's too close and Sibanda leaves
bit of width, not much life in the pitch and this is cross-batted through the infield towards deep extra-cover
dug in, wide of the stumps, rides the bounce and again drops a single behind point

round the wicket, drifting across, gripped and bowled 'im! Narine makes the breakthrough, it wasn't his most threatening delivery ever bowled but Chibhabha had been getting visibly bogged down, he tried to drive but wasn't to the pitch and he actually played inside the line, the ball skidding on to peg back off stump
floated up, plenty of air around the line of off, prodded towards cover defensively
bat-pad chance loops to Pollard, towering under the helmet at short leg, but the umpire rules there was crucially no bat involved ... mighty close to the glove though
leg-stump line, turned towards midwicket
tossed up around leg stump, worked away through midwicket, he's off the mark ... and then he gets those runs upgraded by an overthrow for four
overpitched and that's a lovely shot from Sibanda, who's looking in good touch today, gets a stride in and punches through the covers
turned away towards point, they pick up another run from an overthrow
played back down the track
lets this one through outside off
nasty lifter from Russell and Masakadza does well to keep it down, thrusting his glove up in front of his throat
good length ball outside off, trying to draw the batsman out after pushing him back, but Masakadza leaves

continues round the wicket, tossed up outside leg and Sibanda watches it on to the middle of the bat, heaving it over deep backward square, the fielder back-peddles but it clears both him and the rope
flatter and straighter, goes for the slog-sweep again and misses, hit on the back pad
goes back and plays through the covers for a couple
tossed up on the stumps, straightening and turned into the hands of short leg on the bounce
knuckle-ball from Narina, pitching on off and spinning further away, Sibanda cuts and misses
gets forward and works a single through midwicket
full, possibly a slower ball and picked up from outside off, chipped over mid-on and stopped via a boot on the boundary
width again and Sibanda hammers a cut shot into the ground, leaps up off the turf and Pollard does likewise to make another excellent stop
opens the face and glides a single to third man - looking very assured so far today, is Sibanda
gets forward to defend
good length and in the channel, nothing much happening for the seamers outside off and Masakadza leaves
banged in, short and drifting down the leg side .. tis wide
angling in, turned to leg from the back foot
pushed across, bit of width and this doesn't spin back, Sibanda opens the shoulders and cracks four through point to move within an ace or two of fifty
straighter and flatter, Sibanda tries to play a lap shot but the ball scoots on ends up hitting Sibanda somewhere around the neck
played back on the on side
tossed up on the stumps, worked through midwicket out towards the sweeper
tossed up on the stumps, gets forward to defend
full and drifting across, enticing Masakadza into flinging the bat without much foot movement, it's the doosra though and beats the edge
full and on off, pushed back through mid-on to take Sibanda to fifty - his 18th in his 100th ODI
length outside off, comes forward and pushes into the covers
goes back and dabs a length ball down towards third man
dug in short of a length, sits up nicely but Masakadza misses attempting to hook the ball into the stands
dropped short on the off side for a quick single
searching for the yorker, good full length but slightly wide of off, squeezes under the bat and through to the keeper
full and straight, punched back past Best, who can't quite get down, it nearly clips the non-striker's stumps before mid-on comes across
plays from the crease to a length ball that was tailing in, hit on the knee roll but, despite Best's eager appeal, would have missed leg
tries to tickle the ivories with a short ball but Masakadza doesn't miss out this time, getting on top of the hook and beating the man running round from long leg
full and outside off, takes  the inside edge and rolls narrowly wide of the stumps as Masakadza tried to work out where the ball had gone
good yorker, sliding towards leg stump again, doesn't quite get the bat down and it rolls back off the front pad
coming back in at the man, takes a piece of bat and loops off the pad, short of Best though
short of a length, on the stumps and defended back down the track

got him, cleaned bowled, Sibanda cleaned up! It was full and straight, nothing more complex than that but it seemed to befuddle Sibanda, who'd looked so good, he played around it and pop went the bails
wicket-to-wicket stuff from Bravo, pushed back defensively

and another, two in three balls, Taylor pinned in front! Decides not to review and that was probably wise (though how often does the captain take that route?) ... It was a fullish length ball, drifting back in with the arm, skidded on a little and Taylor played down the wrong line, hit on the back leg in front of off and that would have tipped the cap of leg
good length and speared across outside the left-hander's off stump, left alone
tighter line, brings the bat down to block in front of off
pitched up and blocked back down the track
full and tailing in towards off stump, driven into the ground towards mid-off
full, almost yorker-length, sliding well down the leg side but Masakadza wears it on the pad trying to clip through square
pulls his line across, gets a stride in to push towards cover
and he's called into action when a length ball pops off the thigh pad, the batsman attempting to glance but, fortunately in this case, failing to connect
goes back and dabs the ball through point
very full and straying towards leg stump, chopped through midwicket to the man on the fence
oof, that was close, pulling Ervine outside off and beating the outside edge
and again, whizzing the ball past the outside edge, strange shot from Ervine, walking across and then prodding at the ball rather half-heartedly, lucky not to get anything on it
full of a length and punched on the front foot for a single through the covers
pitched up and drifting back in, gets outside the line of off and dives into the ground back to mid-off
a beauty from Best, he'd have needed a saucepan to hit that, the ball pitching outside leg and jagging across, beating the outside edge as Ervine fenced at it
that's not so good, full and on the pads and whipped forcefully through square leg, well timed and it races to the rope
angled across on a fullish length, drives and takes a thick outside chunk of the bat for a single to third man
back of a length, a yard or so outside off, driven off the back foot to short extra-cover
goes fuller, arrowing in towards middle and off, driven off the inside half of the bat towards mid-on and they sneak a single
pitched up, basically a half-volley outside off and Ervine keeps his shape drive, elbow high, unfortunately straight at extra-cover
pitched up, on the stumps, Bravo keeping it tight, worked off the pad through midwicket
wider, pushed across the left-hander, who chops through the covers towards the sweeper
waits on a full, straight ball and prods it back past the bowler for a single to long-on
length ball, angled across and Ervine opens the face to push square, a misfield at point gets them another run
chance of a run-out, as Masakadza drops the ball short on the off side, Sarwan effects a direct hit but Ervine was home
tight line on off stump, solid forward defensive towards cover
back of a length, lets this one sail through
steps away, taking on a half-tracker and belabouring it cross-batted over deep midwicket for six
pitches it up a bit more, outside off and dabbed square
gets across and pushes a length ball towards point
full and punched coming forwards to mid-off, they scramble through for a relatively comfortable single
length, pitching on the stumps and going across, tapped into the covers between two fielders
drawn into another flirt outside off, the ball sailing through
nicely improvised, walks across to a wide ball and paddles it to leg, slightly aerial but there's no one there and it runs to the long leg boundary
more orthodox this time but the effect is the same, staying back and chopping a cut shot through backward point
length, on the off stump, pushed into the covers
and Bravo beats the outside edge again, Ervine happy to have a dash but doesn't connect with a drive away from the body
stays back and blocks a length ball in front of the wicket
shouts of "catch it!" as the ball pops towards short leg but falls short
turning in from outside off, defended back down the track
floated up outside off and Masakadza is down on one knee to sweep through square leg
touch short, spinning across the left-handed Ervine from over the wicket, beats the bat
strays on to the legs, swept fine against the turn but he covered the line well and the ball trundles away
tossed up and pushed watchfully back to the bowler
well down the leg side - good take from Denesh Ramdin, though, to prevent further damage
slower ball from Bravo, a cutter which Masakadza doesn't really read, tries to drive and gets an inside edge on to his pad, the ball deflecting away on the off side and they pick up one anyway
shuffles across and defends
good length and driven on the up to short extra-cover
full of a length an wide enough for Ervine to free the arms, his square drive is straight at point but it bobbles trough and third man has to clean up
gets on the front foot to push a length ball to mid-off
pitched up full and straight, clipped back down the track and Bravo gathers
touch short, goes back and turns the ball off the body through square on the leg side

length ball, Ervine plays for turn that doesn't materialise and the ball hits the inside edge of the bat and drops on to the wicket - you can basically defend with your edge these days, they're so fat
full and on the stumps, picks up the length and is down to cart this over deep square leg, good connections and that flies all the way
tapped away into a gap in the infield
doosra, going away from the right-handed Masakadza and beating the bat
tossed up nice and slow, waits and tips a single down the ground to long-on
he begins with a full cutter, the batsman waits and punches in front of deep cover, who has a bit of running to do to prevent four
goes back and dabs a length ball to third man
a full toss that almost fails to land on the cut strip - and as bad as it sounds
gets this one to pitch, good tight line in fact, and blocked
defended on the back foot in front of the wicket
slightly short and tapped through square leg off the back foot
slow offcutter a foot or two outside off, Masakadza sees this big and hits it even bigger, the ball taking flight over cow corner to turn a decent over into a costly one
tossed up on the stumps and dabbed into the on side
looped up, drifting outside Ervine's leg stump, he doesn't connect with a sweep but it's a wide anyway
again bungs this down the leg side and short fine leg has to field the ball
over the wicket to Masakadza, who sweeps smartly through square leg
round the wicket, clipped off the pads through square
tossed up, Masakadza's eyes light up but he jams the ball into the ground and back to the bowler
tries to sweep and the ball runs away square off bat and pad
sliding on towards the stumps, tickled round the corner for another single
on the pads and clipped through the leg side
ah ha, there we go, the slow long-hop, countering Masakadza's move to leg, it cramped him for space and he could only shovel the ball towards midwicket off the splice
pitched up and punched back down the wicket
full, almost a yorker, maybe taking the pace off a touch as well, blocked into a gap for one
gets forward outside off and pushes a single short of cover
stays back and taps a short-of-a-length ball into the gully, two fielders converge on it prompting Masakadza to yell something presumably along the lines of "Nogetbackinyourcreaseyoulunatic!"
round the wicket, tossed up on leg stump, attempt to reverse sweep and is hit on the pad
full and slow on the stumps, tickles one through the midwicket area
floated up, Ervine wants to cut but swings too hard and fails to get anything on the ball
bit of room outside off stump and chopped away through point
full and on the leg stump, picks out a fielder at midwicket
drags his length down a tad and pulled forcefully in front of square for a couple into the deep
round the wicket, slightly back of a length outside off and allowed through
straighter line and tapped into the leg side
speared in, on a length and worked wide of mid-on for a single

edged and Ramdin plunges to his right, that's a smart catch and it looks to have got rid of Masakadza! The umpires will ask for a review. The ball was short and wide but Masakadza only managed to top-edge it through, it went low ... and bounced on its way into the gloves. So not out after all
on the stumps, turned short on the leg side
goes back and steers a shortish ball into the gully, it's fielded and the throw hits at the bowler's end but Masakadza had regained his ground
length ball, bit of width and chopped to the fielder at point
tighter to the stumps, Masakadza covers up and defends in front of off
width again but Masakadza, who's struggled with his timing all day, bottom-edges a cut out towards the fielder
sliding on to the pads and this time he gets it right, flicking the ball on the half-volley through backward square, they get three to move him to the brink of a half-century
fired across on a good length and there's a swing-and-a-miss from Ervine
tighter to the off stump, opens the face and steers straight to the point fielder
tapped to mid-off, who is deep, and they charge through for a quick single that takes Masakadza to fifty. Well played.
slashed away through cover point, and they hurry back for the second.
seaming in from round the wicket, Ervine's tuck to leg is hurried, but he gets enough on it to warrant a single.
angled down behind square on the off side, an ambled single is the result.
inside edged! Ervine threw himself into a booming drive but the ball took the inside edge, bouncing past the stumps and a diving Ramdin.
and a dot ball to finish, as Ervine depends.
quick through the air and aimed at off stump to start. Tapped back to the bowler.
quicker still, this time the ball is punched into the covers.
turned behind square, played with the spin, for a single.
past the outside edge! Sharp spin on the orthodox offspinner from Narine. Ervine leaned forward to drive, but the ball buzzed past his edge.
tapped into the covers, and they sprint through.
there's the variation! Flat, fast, and Masakadza made room to cut. The ball gripped and spun away from him, beating his attempted cut.
landing on a length, but a little too straight, and Ervine nudges off the hip for one.
quick, and pitched right up to the bat. Again, Masakadza made room, but toe-ended the drive. Still there's room for a single as the ball rolls into the covers.
a good crack off the bat as Ervine's drive makes contact, but he picks out the man out on the off side so it's just the single.
right up to the bat again, and this one is even better. A quick yorker, and Masakadza digs it out to cover.
speared down the leg side. It's not too far down, but far enough to be called wide.
too quick for Masakadza's leg glance. He's struck on the pad, but they take a leg bye.
hacked towards cover, but straight at the fielder.
flicked to short fine leg, where it's cleanly stopped.
eased out to midwicket, the fielder trots in as they take a single.
Ervine stretches forward and plays with the spin, angling the ball towards point.
again Ervine plays forward, but can't find the gap for a tip-and-run single.
now the sweep is tried, but the ball dips under Ervine's bat and spins into his chest.
finally he finds the single, Narine is a little too straight and they find a single on the leg side.

phew, this could have been interesting! Ervine nudged the ball towards midwicket and was immediately called through for a single by Masakadza. Russell came charging in and threw on the dive, but missed the stumps. It would have been very tight if he'd hit.
another pinpoint yorker! Great Powerplay bowling. Masakadza can only dig it out.
this time it's the length delivery, and Maskadza sends it down to long on with a heave across the line.
a low full toss dips on Ervine as it reaches him, and he jabs down with the bat to keep it out. There's no single to be had, and he remains on 49 not out.

there's the fifty! And rather a good shot to get it. Ervine backs away and scythes a drive out to wide long off, where a sliding fielder saves the boundary. They're back for a second run, and the partnership also progresses beyond 100.
an angled bat sends the ball bouncing down to third man.
Ervine stays very deep in the crease, waiting on the ball to spin and hacking a cut out into the deep.
looped up by Narine. Ervine is lured into a drive, connecting well but picking out the man at cover.
plenty of air on this one, and it's the offspinner. Ervine lunges forward in defense.
the quicker one from Narine, and it rushes on with the arm. It's too short, though, and Ervine has time to rock back and hammer a pull out to deep midwicket. Still no boundaries in this Powerplay.
now there is one! Masakadza backs away, picking Narine's front-of-the-hand delivery and bludgeoning a backfoot punch through cover.
Masakadza stays back once again, turning his wrists over an offspinner to find a single to midwicket.
an attempted paddle straight away by Masakadza, but he can't quite execute the stroke.
a more orthodox stroke this time, but Masakadza's drive finds the fielder and it's another dot.

Bravo breaks through! A tame dismissal after what has been a good knock. Masakadza was looking to hurry things along, and made room as Bravo looped down a slow offcutter. The barrel-chested batsman hoicked across the line at it, and a swirling top edge was easily held by Narine running in from third man. This was turning into a really useful stand for the Zimbabweans.
Bravo shoots one across Ervine's bows, the left-hander stepping forward with an angled blade to run the ball down to third man.
Waller wants a single to get off the mark, but there's none to be had as he tucks a full delivery straight to midwicket.
another slower one. Waller shovels a drive to Russell's left at cover, and there's time for a single as the fielder tumbles over to stop it.
chopped down to cover point, where there's a fielder quite close to the bat.
this went like a legbreak, squaring Waller up and taking the outside edge. He does well to play with soft hands, running the ball down past slip and taking a single.
the same shot, but in reverse. The ball grips and spins across Ervine, who does well to cover the turn - just about - and they sprint back for the second.
this fairly spat off the track! Ervine was pressing forward, but the ball kicked up at him and struck the splice.
nudged into the leg side
well played by Waller. He stayed back and read the spin off the pitch, cutting down to third man as the ball spun away from him.
he comes round the wicket to Ervine, who slashes a low full toss towards point.
fetched into the leg side, and they take a second before the throw comes in.

there's a confident stroke! Roach dug in a searing bouncer at the new batsman, but he just rocked back and spanked a pull over deep midwicket. The fielder catches the ball, but he's several metres over the boundary rope.
four more! Waller is striking this ball fiercely. After trying the short one Roach slung one down full outside off. Waller made room and sent a scorching drive through extra cover.

he's bowled him off a no-ball! A fast yorker burst through Waller's swishing defense ... and the no-ball comes from the square leg umpire! What's happened here? Ah, there were too many men outside the circle. Tino Best is the guilty fielder. Roach is fuming, and rightly so!

that's got to hurt. Immediately after bowling Waller with a no-ball that wasn't his fault, Roach is paddled for a second six, Waller lapping a low full toss over fine leg. Such was the pace in the delivery, it carried all the way. Zimbabwe should be aiming beyond 260 now.
another yorker to finish, but this one is safely dug out. What an over, 20 from it. It's certainly woken the crowd up.
quicker one from Bravo, and Ervine can't get it away.
a slow offcutter is glanced down to fine leg, where the fielder is out on the boundary.
tapped to cover, another one to the total. Bravo is restoring some order so far in this over.
pushed through the covers.
another slower ball, and it's picked by Waller, who runs it down to third man.
very full, aimed at the base of middle. Ervine digs it out, and they take a single as Bravo palms the ball towards mid-off.
smart shot! Ervine backs away as Roach comes round the wicket at him, intentionally angling the ball through the vacant slip area and past the diving Ramdin.

even better! What a strike from Ervine. Roach offered a friendly delivery, quick but in the zone to be hit. Ervine made soom room and shellacked a booming drive over extra cover. Way back into the stands.
and he follows that up with a single into the off side, putting Waller on strike.
slower ball from Roach, and Waller is already through his wild heave as the ball reaches him. Fortunately for him, it bounces over middle.
hacked in the air, up and over cover point! Bravo had brought the man in from cover point, so the shot was on.

gone this time! A little too cute from Waller. He made room and was aiming to run the ball through the vacant slip region, but it was another slower one and he was at it too soon. The ball crept past him and rattled the stumps. The celebration from Roach isn't the most expressive.
flat-batted over extra cover! Ervine is playing a blinder. It was a half volley from Bravo, but he absolutely hammered it.
that's better from Bravo. Closer to the bat, and Ervine's got no room to work with.
Bravo's slower one goes awry, looping down the leg side. Ervine aims to paddle it, but can't lay bat on ball.
the attempted yorker is heading down the leg side when it glances off Ervine's foot, and the ball is stopped just inside the boundary.

gone! Bravo strikes, and Zimbabwe suffer a double blow. Bravo fired this one down full and fast, and in fact the ball was a full toss aimed right at the middle of the stumps. Ervine backed away and swung, but his bat flashed over the ball and his stumps were disturbed. Bravo has his fourth, and West Indies are right back into the game. Zimbabwe don't have a lot of firepower in their lower middle order.
Utseya is off the mark straight away, tapping the ball to midwicket.
and Chakabva follows suit, finding a single behind square.
flung down the leg side, Chakabva can't get any bat on it and that's a wide.
straighter from Best, and on a length. Chakabva plays the ball towards point and they set off.

sharp running! Utseya dropped the ball down very close to Ramdin, but Chakabva wanted the single and set off straight away. Ramdin shied, but Chakabva is very quick between the wickets and he's easily home.
a slower ball from Best, the offcutter. Chakabva picks it and turns the ball to square leg.
these two are milking the singles quite well. Utseya gets very low and cuts the ball quite late down to third man.
nudged to leg, one more to the total. Good running.
yet another cheeky single as Utseya looks to angle the ball behind square. Frustrating for the fielding side, but they won't mind too much as the boundaries have dried up after the wickets.
Utseya targets the boundary this time, but his airy shot results only in a play-and-miss.
that's better. Utseya picks a slower ball and flicks a single to leg.

huge heave! Chakabva threw absolutely everything into this stroke, looking to leather it over deep midwicket. He tried to hit it just a little too hard, perhaps, and ended up skewing it off the thigh towards point.
slower one from Roach, and Utseya makes room to punch the ball through cover point.
angled down to third man, one more to the total.
another slower ball from Roach, and Utseya chops it down into the off side.
sharp yorker! Utseya was fortunate this one wasn't aimed at the stumps. He backed away but Best followed him with a searing yorker that zipped under the bat.
he lays bat on this one, Best just missing the yorker mark and Utseya turning the ball to square leg.
a slower ball is slogged out into the deep ... but it slows up, and is hurled back as they complete the third run.
sprayed down the leg side, a clear wide. Ramdin can't quite collect cleanly, and they take a run.
Chakabva is down on one knee as he looks to smear this down the ground. Great flourish, but precious little result.

he's hit this one! A remarkable shot. He picked the ball up off middle stump and sent it arcing out over deep square leg. The shot never got up too high, but it went way over the boundary. Ferociously hit.
another slower ball to end the over, and Chakabva forces it away through cover.

Bravo has five! Chakabva attempts to repeat the big shot from the last over, but he slices too far underneath it and Pollard holds onto a steepler. Pollard called for it straight away, and settled underneath the ball as it plummeted down. The Zimbabweans had to go for everything in this final over, but Chakabva's efforts will have been appreciated by his team.
scooped to midwicket, and they sprint through.
a slower ball, Jarvis just about picks it and plays the ball to leg to get off the mark.
even slower from Bravo. Utseya has no pace whatsoever to work with, but picks a gap and they take another single.

six for Bravo! Yet another slower delivery, and Jarvis made to room to try to carve the ball over cover. He didn't get close to timing it, however, tapping a limp catch straight to Dwayne's younger brother Darren.
Bravo ends with a quicker ball, and Utseya swings it away towards midwicket. The fielder has some ground to make, and so they've got time to rush back for a second run.

inn2.comm: the loosener is pushed through wide of Powell's off stump, and he has a look at it, leaving well alone.
this time there is a shot, Powell standing tall to crack a length delivery straight at the backward point fielder.
Jarvis aims fuller, but he's outside off once again and Powell is happy to leave alone.
this looked a touch quicker through the air from Jarvis, and is bowled at just over 132kph. He's hits a spot just short of a good length, and Powell punches to cover.
a gentle delivery offers Powell the chance to get off the mark with a boundary. Jarvis sends down a low full toss outside off, and it's caressed through cover.
on a length, and leaving the batsman off the pitch. Angled down to third man.

gentle start from Chatara, and a very brave leave from Powell! The ball shaped in through the air at the left hander, who shouldered arms even as the ball curled past his off stump. Gentle pace, just 124.2kph.

a shocker from Jarvis! It wasn't the greatest delivery from Chatara, but this should have been a wicket for Zimbabwe. Powell toe-ended a pull at a long-hop, and the ball looped toward fine leg, but Jarvis had run in too far and the ball sailed over him! It landed on the rope. He'd have caught that easily if he'd been closer to the boundary.
pushed too far down the leg side, and some movement takes it further in that direction.
was this a deliberate slower ball? Just 117.9kph, and it's an offcutter. Defended.
wicket-to-wicket stuff, and Powell offers a defensive bat.
just gentle medium pace from Chatara, but it's accurate and Powell defends once more.
Chatara has zoned in on a length quite quickly, and yet more defense ends the over.
full and straight, driven to mid-on
132.8kph from Jarvis, and it's an awkward length. Sarwan prods into the leg side.
too straight from Jarvis, and Sarwan eases off the mark with a neat clip to the midwicket boundary.
Jarvis re-adjusts his line, and Sarwan pats the ball into the off side.
driven by the right-hander, but it's hit straight to the man at short extra cover.
a good delivery to end the over. Jarvis hits a good length at 131.4kph and Sarwan pushes it into the off side.
Chatara picks up where he left off, and Powell defends an offcutter on a good length.
a touch too wide from Chatara, and Powell cuts - but the shot is stopped by a diving Sibanda at backward point. Chatara operating almost entirely in the mid-120kph range.
left alone this time.
forced off the back foot, but he can't get through the inner ring.
hurled much too far down the off side, a big wide.
better from Chatara. He pitches this one right up to Powell, the ball snaking in through the air as it nears the batsman. Pushed to mid-on.

a stunning effort from Sibanda goes to waste! Chatara lured Powell into a drive, and he struck it out of the middle ... but Sibanda leapt up at short extra cover and plucked the ball out of mid air. A remarkable catch, like snatching a swift out of the air. But it's a no-ball! Chatara's foot is a good inch over the line. So, instead of a maiden ODI wicket, it's a free hit.

heaved down the ground! Powell was looking to smash this out of the park, but it was the slower one and he didn't quite time it. He got too far underneath it, but the ball fell safely and plugged in the outfield.
shaping away from the bat, and Sarwan runs the ball down through gully for one.
pitched up to the bat, and Powell defends into the off side.
testing delivery! Jarvis got this one to hold its line outside off, at 133.9kph, to beat Powell's outside edge.
he attempts to follow that up with a yorker, but it's sprayed well wide of the off stump.
much straighter, but pitched right up to the bat. Powell's drive is stopped at mid-off.
rising off a length, Powell guides to point.
a good, diving stop by Chibhabha at cover point saves a couple of runs as Sarwan punches the ball powerfully off the back foot. Decent pace from Jarvis too, 134.3kph.
Chatara begins his third over with a wide down the leg side.

shot! A little quicker through the air from Chatara, but still gentle at just 126.7kph, and Sarwan leans forward to thread a superb drive through extra cover. Shades of his best in that stroke. No great flourish in it, but the technique is classical and correct, the elbow high, and the ball pings out of the middle.
a better length from Chatara. Not quite there to drive.

dispatched! Chatara attempted to hurry Sarwan with a bouncer, but he just doesn't have the pace. The ball was delivered at 130.3kph and sat up, waiting to be hit. Sarwan rocked back and spanked it through midwicket. Imperious.
shaping away from the bat. Sarwan plays with soft hands to work a single behind square on the off side.
on a length, and nicely straight. Powell defends.
pitched up, and well wide of off. Powell leans into a strong drive, but aims it at the cover fielder.
Jarvis aims a full delivery at Sarwan's middle stump, but the angle on the delivery means it's easily glanced through square leg for a couple.
a sliced cut is stopped by the third man fielder.
Powell comes forward with an angled bat, pushing the ball towards gully.
Jarvis floats this one right up to the bat, searching for swing, but Powell drives the ball straight back to him.

Jarvis has taken the bails off with his hand! Not quite in the Finn fashion, but he got a little too close to the stumps as he delivered, and flicked the bails off with his right hand. It's not a no-ball, of course, as the new rule hasn't come into effect yet.
forced off the back foot, but straight to backward point.
on a length and aimed at the top of off. Sarwan defends.
hurled down the leg side. Chatara has generally been accurate, but when it goes wrong it goes wrong badly.
punched square off the back foot.
fuller, and straighter. Sarwan flicks to midwicket.
this one came in off the pitch, but it was seam movement rather than off-cut. Played to leg.
full outside off, and inviting the drive. The shot goes straight to mid-off.
definite seam movement once again, and good lift off the track despite the lack of pace. Sarwan took his bottom hand off the bat as he fended at it just a little, the ball rolling to fine leg.
Jarvis begins his fifth over with a fairly swift bouncer, but Sarwan ducks underneath it without harm.
another bouncer, but this was a deliberate slower-ball effort. It was outside off, too, and Sarwan was happy to let it go.
just short of a good length once again. Sarwan pulls, but he's perhaps just a little too early into the shot, and it's stopped at mid-on.
a hint of with offered outside off, but the stroke goes to point. This is shaping up to be a good, controlled over from Jarvis.
a good length delivery, and Sarwan is half forward as he meets it with a defensive bat.
Jarvis ends a good over with another accurate delivery, and Sarwan defends from the crease. A maiden.
pushed through outside off. Powell leaves it alone.
this time he lays bat on ball, but he can't thread the gap.

shoddy fielding from Waller. Powell came forward to drive a slow offcutter, but the shot should have been cut off. Waller, at mid-off, had some ground to make, but tumbled right over the ball and let it through his hands.
a square drive is stopped at point.
a short ball rises outside off, and Powell attempts to upper cut it. The ball just stops on him a little, however, and the only result is a single to third man.
pushed to point, where the fielder cuts it off.
full, and aimed at off stump. Powell defends with angled bat and they take a single to third man.
cracked square of the wicket, but straight to the fielder.
nudged gently into the leg side.
again Sarwan works to leg, but this time finds the gap.
too straight from Chibhabha, and he's glanced through square leg.
pushed out to cover point, and a single ends the over.
tosses it up generously, full, Sarwan forward to smother it
spins in from a good length, Sarwan pushes to long on from the crease
punched down to long off for one more
allows it to spin from outside off, good length, but finds midwicket with a tuck
a nudge now, with the turn, but to midwicket once more
dabs it to off but rather too weakly and the keeper gets to it
bounce from short of a length, neatly dabbed down to third man
comes forward and drives, mid off does not have too much ground to make to his left, but Sarwan is home comfortably
good length, on the pads, though, and easily flicked out to deep square
too close to off stump, Sarwan tries to run it away, but finds backward point
on middle now, and is turned away with a flourish down to wide long on
these two need to push on now, midwicket in the way of another Sarwan push, parries the ball towards the bowler with a dive
shortish, and Sarwan makes some room to cut, for a single to the sweeper
stays in the crease to a length ball and punches down to long off
angled in from wide of the crease, but too much on it and it carries down leg
lost of flight, Sarwan picks it from outside off and turns it through midwicket along the ground
asking rate nearly six now as Powell turns another innocuous length ball off pad to midwicket
on the pads once more, this time he manages to work it square for one
slower one looped in full around off, dug back to the bowler
bounce from a good length, but Sarwan handles it well as he runs it down to third man
angled very wide of the left-hander, who goes hard at it, fortunately for him, the thick edge does not carry to short third
these dot balls might cost West Indies later, he could have put this away easily, but punches it straight to extra cover off the back foot
a single eased down to long on off a full delivery
Powell breaks free with a skip down the pitch, and lifts this one from middle over the long on boundary
comes out again, but hits it off the inner part of the bat this time through square leg
worked through midwicket with the turn for one
punched off the back foot down to the sweeper
on the front foot to glide it towards point, and won't get the single
full outside off, and Powell drives to mid-off.

slashed in the air past point! Masakadza floated this one right up, and well wide of off. Powell went after it, and slapped the ball in the air ... but too far from Sibanda at backward point to be in real danger.
straighter from the bowler, and Powell plays the ball to leg.
driven square once again, but along the ground and this time Sibanda is in place to cut it off.
turned off the toes for a single.
Sarwan waits on a slow legcutter and plays it down to shirt third man.
looped up outside off, pushed softly back down the wicket by Sarwan.
Sarwan stays deep in his crease and nudges an offspinner to point.
flicked with the spin into the leg side, and they take a single as deep midwicket runs in.

a little short, and turning away from the left-hander off the track. Powell cuts, and though the shot is stopped at point they take a single ... and Sarwan is almost run out! A better throw would've really tested his legs!
turned into the leg side, another single the result.

almost another run out! Powell tapped the ball to Sibanda's right at short extra cover and wandered out of his crease. The fielder charged in with Powell stranded mid-pitch, but swooped a little too quickly and couldn't pick up the ball! Zimbabwe just aren't taking their chances.
driven to Jarvis at long off for a single.
defended towards cover.
a flashy drive, with Powell down on one knee, is stopped at cover.
the googly is exhibited early on by Mushangwe, but it's picked and cut to point.
floated up to the bat, and Powell drives to long-off.
Sarwan comes well forward and leans over a full delivery, working it into the leg side.
Utseya resumes proceedings with a quicker one, but spears the ball down the leg side.

Utseya isn't the biggest turner of the ball, but there's something in this pitch for him. This one lands well outside off, but Sarwan has to be sure to have bat and pad close together in defense as it spins sharply in towards him.
more spin, but the length isn't quite right and Sarwan is able to work with the turn, earning a single
another error in the field by Zimbabwe, this time Chakabva is the culprit. Powell cut the ball towards him, but he fumbled the stop and gifted a single.
looped up enticingly, but Sarwan is happy to defend.
glanced towards midwicket, and into the gap.
too short from Utseya, and Powell's backfoot punch goes out to deep cover.
pushed through quicker by the young leggie, and Powell defends.
an appeal for lbw! How close was this? Powell missed the sweep and was struck on the pad. Was this spinning down the leg side? The umpire was unmoved, and Zimbabwe chose not to review it.
spinning from Powell's off to leg, and it's turned with the spin straight to square leg.
a quicker one, rushing on with the arm, is guided through gully.
plenty of rip from Mushangwe, but Sarwan is well forward to smother the spin.
and more watchful defense ends the over.
full outside off, really slow, and driven to cover.
straighter from Masakadza, and there's no pace or width for Powell to work with.
chipped down the ground, but short of Sibanda at long on! The chip appeared to be deliberate, Powell not trying to hit the ball too hard.
Sarwan stays back in his crease and chops a legcutter between the men in the covers.
drilled down to long off.
very slow indeed through the air, and Sarwan waits an age before cutting hard out to the cover sweeper.
Sarwan comes forward to thread a drive through extra cover.
Powell waits on a cut, but sends the ball straight at the fielder.

a gift takes Powell to fifty! This one must have slipped out of the hand. It ended up as a huge full toss outside leg, and Powell was happy to sweep it powerfully over the man at short fine leg and away for four. Back-to-back fifties for Powell, and that shot also takes West Indies beyond 100.
Mushangwe lands this one, and it spins sharply in towards the left-hander, who offers a perpendicular defensive bat.
driven down the ground.
pushed out to deep cover once again, Sarwan stretching forward to get to the pitch of the delivery.
Sarwan very nearly mis-reads the pace of this delivery, driving slightly too early at it. He takes the bottom hand off the bat, however, and the ball falls short of the man at extra cover.
very full, and driven down to long off.
Powell bends down to sweep a looping leg-side delivery, but the ball dips underneath his bat and hits him on the pad. Pitching well outside leg.
eased down to long off.
a touch quicker through the air, and Sarwan flicks the ball off his hip for a single.
an offcutter from Masakadza, but there isn't too much deviation off the track and Powell drives easily to long off.
Powell might've made more of this full toss. He sweeps out to deep midwicket, but with no great power.
a darting drive rolls to backward point.
too short from Mushangwe, and the ball sits up as Sarwan rocks back, but his shot is stopped at extra cover.
punched to long off.
Powell works with the spin in towards him, and looks for a single as the ball rolls towards midwicket. There's a fielder there, and Sarwan is quick to deny the run.
pushed through much quicker by Mushangwe, and the ball rushes on to strike the inner half of Powell's poking bat. There's some excitement behind the wicket, but the ball rolls safely to leg.
driven hard, but straight back to the bowler.
the bottom hand comes in to play as Sarwan flaps an innocuous looking delivery down to long on.
slapped high in the air over extra cover ... the shot has more height than distance in it, and the ball plugs in the outfield as long off runs round.

well taken by Taylor! Powell was rooted to the crease as he looked to blast this length delivery into the leg side, and all he could do was feather an edge through to Taylor, who is up to the stumps. He holds onto a sharp reflex catch, and Masakadza has broken through for Zimbabwe!
a full delivery draws Bravo forward, and he pushes it gently to cover point.

he's got another one! A double strike for Masakadza! Taylor bellows his celebration as he holds another great catch behind the stumps, and Masakadza is beaming from ear to ear as he's mobbed by his team-mates. The ball left Bravo ever so slightly off the track as he pressed forward with an angled bat, taking a thin edge. Plucky slow medium pace and some great keeping has brought Zimbabwe right back into this.
spinning sharply away from Sarwan, who offers no stroke. Some bounce too, for such a short bowler.
pitched up, and pushed back to the bowler.
eased through the covers.
Deonarine is off the mark straight away, flicking to leg.

Taylor whips the bails off! This delivery from Mushangwe drifted in, gripped and spun away to beat Sarwan's outside edge as he lunged forward. Taylor had the bails off in a flash, but the back foot was grounded the entire time.
a touch too short this time, and Sarwan steps back to cut to point.
driven to long off.
Deonarine is forward to drive, but picks out the fielder.
this time he finds the gap to pick up a single to long off.

something of an awkward fend from Sarwan, as he pushes at an offcutter one-handed, but he gets bat on it and the ball rolls to fine leg, allowing him a single to get to fifty. A patient knock, and West Indies need him to push on and anchor the innings now.
"No run, no run!" screams Taylor as Deonarine turns a length delivery to leg. And indeed, the fielder is in quickly to stop the run.
punched back to the bowler.
Sarwan presses forward in defense as Mushangwe continues his controlled spell.
Sarwan flicks against the spin to pick up a single to midwicket.
a little too straight to Deonarine, who glances to fine leg.
pitching middle and spinning away, Sarwan unable to find the gap.
another accurate delivery brings a dot ball.
much too short to finish, sitting up and Sarwan slams a pull out to deep midwicket. But there's cover there, so it's just a single.

a better throw would've run Deonarine out! Sarwan flashed a one-handed cut to backward point and Deonarine called him through, but the throw from the fielder was wild and Taylor couldn't break the stumps in time.
on a length outside off. Deonarine leaves well alone.
drilled hard, but straight to extra cover.
a diving stop at extra cover stops Deonarine's drive and saves a run.
Masakadza slips in a short one, and Deonarine hammers a pull out to deep midwicket. The batsmen take a second before Chatara can fire in his return.

what on earth has happened here? This looked like Sarwan was run out, but he's batting on! Chakabva rifled in a throw from mid-off as Sarwan took a chancy single, and it looked mighty close. In fact, I'd suggest that it was out! But Umpire Nero ruled it not out. This is atrocious. Replays show that Sarwan was a good eight inches short of his crease. The umpire refuses to send it upstairs. Zimbabwe have fluffed a couple of their chances, and now they've been robbed of a wicket.
a leading edge loops up and over cover.
turned to leg.
chopped to cover for one.
Deonarine finds the gap for another single.
and that'll really rub it in. Sarwan hammers a short ball over deep midwicket to end the over.
defended by Deonarine.
yet more defense from the left-hander.
slapped through the off side for a single.
turned away with the spin.
watchful defense from Deonarine.
looped up outside off, and driven out to deep cover.
another drive from Deonarine brings a single.
full straight, and with minimal pace to work with Sarwan can't get it away.
Sarwan pings the cover field with a drive.
a short ball is clubbed up and over the infield, and they rush back for a second.
much slower through the air, the offcutter, and Sarwan prods it to cover.
hammered away, two more to the total - but just five from the over.
the big shot had to come sooner or later from Deonarine, and he's played it in style! A slog sweep sends the ball flying over wide long on.
and he follows that up with a single, playing the ball into the off side. Good batting.
Sarwan rocks back to thrash a cut out into the deep.
tapped softly to cover ... there's some hesitation, but Sarwan calls him through.
again Sarwan stays deep in his crease, and cuts against the turn for a single.
spinning away from Deonarine, who slashes it away behind point for a couple.
a slow cutter is tapped down close on the off side ... Sarwan wanders out of his crease, but is swiftly sent back.
this stroke is a little more forceful, and the gap is picked at cover point.
pushed towards cover point. The fielder is in quickly to stop the run.
a firm backfoot punch brings a single out to the cover sweeper.
Sarwan comes forward to drive to long off.
Deonarine taps a slow, looping delivery into the covers, placing it between the fielders to earn a single.
Chatara begins with a long hop, Deonarine swivelling into a slightly wild pull shot but getting a good enough connection to beat the fielder at long leg.

that's better from the bowler, hitting a length with a slow cutter as Deonarine drives to cover. Chatara has a really odd action. His left arm is very still, almost motionless at his side. It's not involved in his action at all.
and again, Deonarine can't make anything of this one.
a wide full toss is slapped through point, where the fielder gets a hand to it to take some of the sting out of the shot.
a slower ball is placed just wide of the fielder in the covers, and they take a single.

just short of the fielder! Sarwan played much to early at this - another slower one. He took the bottom hand off the bat, but the ball still flew in the air ... but dropped just short of the fielder at point!
full and straight, but not quite the yorker and Deonarine is able to turn it to midwicket.
shot! Jarvis erred with the yorker once more, sending this one through as a low full toss. Sarwan clears his front leg and laced the drive through cover. The boundary West Indies need in this over.
a slower ball is chopped straight down into the ground, but the fielder is on the edge of the circle so they sprint through for a single.
a high full toss is bunted down to long off.
a Sarwan signature stroke! Jarvis offers width outside off and Sarwan is in position to scythe a cut behind point.
finally he gets the yorker spot on, and it's dug out to mid off, who is on the edge of the ring.
Sarwan walks down the track at Chatara, and heaves a length delivery down to long on.
a good yorker by the young seamer, and Deonarine can only dig it out back down the track.
Very full once again. Deonarine drills it straight down the pitch, the ball ricocheting off the stumps and rolling to long on.
a pressure-relieving six! It's a length delivery, so Sarwan is able to get underneath it and flat-bat a six straight down the ground.
and another boundary! The Zimbabwean bowlers are leaking runs in this Powerplay. Sarwan slaps a full toss to extra cover, placing it between the fielders.
a short one to end the over, and it's pulled out to deep square.
a good start from the leggie, keeping Sarwan to dot ball.
quicker through the air, but too short and Sarwan cuts out to the cover sweeper.
driven down the ground.
Sarwan sets himself for a pull, but the shot goes straight to mid-on.
Mushangwe escapes undue punishment for a full toss, Sarwan driving out to the cover sweeper again.
speared in flat and fast. Deonarine turns the ball off his pads for a single.
he starts with a length delivery that is punched off the back foot through cover point.
and now the slower delivery, but Sarwan spots it and glances through square leg.
a low full toss is drilled into the covers, where it's well stopped by the fielder - Mushangwe.
another good save by Mushangwe in the covers, sliding to keep the batsmen to one.

a towering six takes Sarwan to 99! He's gone at this ball one handed, but it boomed out of the middle of the blade and carried all the way. The crowd are cheering their support as the West Indies 200 comes up in style.

there it is! Jarvis aims one at the toes, but Sarwan is able to push the ball down to long on for the single to take him to his century. Will this complete his rehabilitation and return to the West Indies side?
he's on the mark straight away, Sarwan pressing forward to tap the ball towards mid-off.
drifting in towards the pads, Sarwan drives to long on.
Deonarine is struck on the thigh as he misses out on a paddle-pull, but there's no room for a leg bye.
swung out to wide long on. Taylor screams at the fielder as a wild throw evades both the bowler and the keeper himself.
quicker through the air, driven into the covers.
pushed through quicker still, this time Deonarine threads a gap on the leg side.
good, accurate start as he pins Deonarine to the crease.
heaved out to wide long on, they take a single as the fielder runs round.
tapped close in on the off side, and they sprint through. Utseya is bowling very slowly indeed.
Sarwan skips out, but Utseya spots him coming and adjusts his length.
the ball spins in and strikes the pad as Sarwan thrusts at it, and rolls into space.
tapped to cover. Deonarine looks for a single, but there's none to be had.
it's not the greatest looking shot, but it's just what West Indies need. He flat bats Mushangwe down the ground for his first boundary against a spinner in this game.
zipped down full and straight by Mushangwe. Sarwan can't get this one away.
this is more classical Sarwan! Mushangwe lands one close to the bat and Sarwan sends the ball straight back over his head for four more, with a straighter bat this time.
speared down the leg side, it strikes the pad and they take a leg bye.
turned with the spin into the leg side.

is this run out? It is! Marvellous work from Utseya. Deonarine flicked the ball towards mid on, and Utseya himself charged after it, turning and throwing down the stumps in one movement. Surely, surely, surely they will send this one upstairs? Yes, Umpire Cloete asks for a replay, and Deonarine is short. That's not the end of the drama, though, as for some reason a 'Not Out' signal flashes on the big screen even as a red light is flashing to indicate the batsman is out ... which he is, and eventually he trudges off.
Sarwan stays in his crease, rolling his wrists over the ball to find a single to square leg.
nudged to short fine leg, where some quick fielding stops the single.
this time Pollard places the ball squarer through square leg, and is off the mark.
nudged to midwicket, where the fielders converge but not quickly enough to stop the run.
Sarwan hangs deep in his crease and cuts through point for a single.
and Pollard strikes the first blow! He barely seemed to hit this, just leaned into the stroke and followed through to send the ball sailing over long on. Effortless.
four more! Mushangwe slips in a high full toss, and Pollard bludgeons it to wide long on, where the fielder dives and gets a hand to it, but can't quite cut it off.
drilled down to long on.
pushed through quickly, Sarwan's drive goes straight to the fielder.
Sarwan is on the cut this time, but a diving stop at backward point saves runs.
speared at leg stump, Pollard uses the angle to nudge the ball through square leg.
looped up, and Sarwan can't quite put it away.
hurled way down the leg side. Taylor can't cut it off, and they take a single to add to the wide.
Pollard's bottom hand sends the ball to midwicket.
punted down the ground for a single.
down the leg side once again. There may have been a vague stumping chance of Taylor had taken this cleanly.
glanced to short fine leg, and the fielder returns the ball in a flash.
bashed down to long on, straight to the fielder.

a horrid start from Jarvis, who offers Pollard a leg-stump half volley that is gleefully put away for four. What's more, Jarvis has knocked the bails off at the non-striker's end for the third time today. Come October, that'll be a no-ball.
hammered away! After the full toss, an attempted bouncer, but Jarvis doesn't have the pace to hurry Pollard and the ball races to the boundary.
that's a much better delivery, but it still costs runs. Close to the yorker, but Pollard's big bat send the ball to wide long on, and they push hard for a second.
Pollard has almost swung himself off his feet trying to send this one into orbit. It was the slower ball from Jarvis, and Pollard played much too early at it.
full again, and Pollard drives to long on.
another slower one from Jarvis, but Sarwan spots this one and sends the ball to long on.
Chatara is short to start with, and Sarwan pulls out to deep square. That's taken him to his best ever score in ODI cricket.

boom! This has come off the inner half of the bat, almost a thick inside edge, yet it's bounced just once before it's skimmed over the wide long on boundary. Pollard has such incredible power in his hitting.
short of a length once again, and Pollard swivels as he pulls out into the deep.
another attempted bouncer, but it's far too short and balloons way over the batsman. Called wide by the umpire.
yet another bouncer, this one a slower one. Pollard is too early in the shot, but takes a single after he cue-ends it to point.
eased into the leg side.
enormous. A monstrosity of a strike goes miles over wide long on. Chatara offered up a friendly length delivery and like a magician, with one swish of his wand Pollard made it disappear.
a low full toss is nudged through square leg.
the crowd want Pollard to finish this with one hit, but he can only pick up a single as he pushes a Jarvis slower ball through the covers.
another slower one, and Sarwan punches it through extra cover off the back foot.
a short ball with no great pace on it is pulled through square leg.
turned off the pads, but straight to the fielder and there's no run to be had.
there it is! Sarwan strikes the winning runs, glancing through square leg, to get the spectators dancing in the stands.
